solution_line_template: The rest of the collection is {total_games} games - {games_at_12} games = <<{total_games}-{games_at_12}={rest_games}>>{rest_games} games.
{percent_7} of these games means {percent_7} * {rest_games} games = <<{percent_7}*{rest_games}={games_at_7}>>{games_at_7} games.
Daniel bought them for ${price_7} each, so he had to spend {games_at_7} games * ${price_7}/game = $<<{games_at_7}*{price_7}={spent_7}>>{spent_7} on them.
The other {games_at_3} games were bought for ${price_3} each, so they've cost him {games_at_3} games * ${price_3}/game = $<<{games_at_3}*{price_3}={spent_3}>>{spent_3}.
On all games in total Daniel spent ${spent_12} + ${spent_7} + ${spent_3} = $<<{spent_12}+{spent_7}+{spent_3}={total_spent}>>{total_spent}.
